intro: Ixora canescens, commonly known as the white flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Ixora canescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
